item.title: [News] How Hong Kong National Security Law affects Americans
item.description: Even among world-shattering news coming out of US almost every day, the Hong Kongâ€™s National Security Law stands out to affect Americans long term. The CCP passed Hong Kong National Security Law to curb pro-democracy and pro-autonomy movement in Hong Kong. The law codifies crimes against secession, subversion, terrorism, and collusion with any foreign entities, from institution to persons. The secession law (Article 20) is broad to cover any actions aiming at undermining national unity.
